comments:
When I lauche VE by "Open Editor menu" on a classe of type Frame that I'm just
create)
I get this error : 
   An internal error occurred during: "Setup Java Visual Editor"
the stack is :
java.lang.IllegalAccessError: tried to access method
org.eclipse.pde.internal.core.WorkspaceModelManager.getWorkspaceModel(Lorg/eclipse/core/resources/IProject;)Lorg/eclipse/pde/core/IModel;
from class org.eclipse.jem.internal.proxy.core.ProxyPlugin
	at
org.eclipse.jem.internal.proxy.core.ProxyPlugin.processPlugin(ProxyPlugin.java:767)
	at
org.eclipse.jem.internal.proxy.core.ProxyPlugin.expandProject(ProxyPlugin.java:762)
	at
org.eclipse.jem.internal.proxy.core.ProxyPlugin.getIDsFound(ProxyPlugin.java:716)
	at
org.eclipse.jem.internal.proxy.core.ProxyLaunchSupport.startImplementation(ProxyLaunchSupport.java:321)
	at
org.eclipse.jem.internal.proxy.core.ProxyLaunchSupport.startImplementation(ProxyLaunchSupport.java:259)
	at
org.eclipse.ve.internal.java.codegen.editorpart.JavaVisualEditorPart.createProxyFactoryRegistry(JavaVisualEditorPart.java:942)
	at
org.eclipse.ve.internal.java.codegen.editorpart.JavaVisualEditorPart$Setup.initializeForProject(JavaVisualEditorPart.java:1460)
	at
org.eclipse.ve.internal.java.codegen.editorpart.JavaVisualEditorPart$Setup.initialize(JavaVisualEditorPart.java:1341)
	at
org.eclipse.ve.internal.java.codegen.editorpart.JavaVisualEditorPart$Setup.run(JavaVisualEditorPart.java:1255)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:66)
Please provide details of Eclipse, VE, EMF and GEF build versions.

As Alasdair asked, please provide the versions. The reason is this error would
occur with a mismatch of versions. There was a one-week period where Eclipse
changed an internal api and then a week later changed it back. We had changed to
use the new api, and then had to change back. If you had mixed just the right
combination of Eclipse and VE versions you would have hit this.

Actually the best suggestion is to step up to:

http://download.eclipse.org/tools/ve/downloads/drops/S-S20040628-200406281448/index.html

This uses the 3.0.0 final release of Eclipse and GEF, and a current driver of
EMF. The error should not occur here.

If you step up and the error goes away, please cancel this bug. Thanks.

This bug don't exist with version found here :
http://download.eclipse.org/tools/ve/downloads/drops/S-S20040628-200406281448/index.html


Thanks to richkulp@us.ibm.com
1.0M2 is out, so these are now closed in M2.
